source.title: RIPA w/o protease inhibitor
RIPA Lysis Buffer

source.description: Before use, thaw and add 1 tablet of protease inhibitor (PI) per 10 ml aliquot. (Roche cOmplete™, Mini Protease Inhibitor Cocktail).

source.title: Harvesting Cells and Preparing Lysate

source.description: Wash confluent 10 cm plate of cells 2X in ice cold PBS.

source.body: Always keep everything on ice, unless otherwise indicated.

source.title: Harvesting Cells and Preparing Lysate

source.description:
Add
to cells, and scrape the cells to remove them from the dish. Transfer to a pre-chilled 2 ml tube
.

source.title: Harvesting Cells and Preparing Lysate

source.description:
Transfer supernatant to a clean LoBind Protein 1.5 ml tube as lysate. To avoid multiple freeze-thaw cycles, make aliquots (generally
each).

source.body: Additional Sonicator or BioEruptor sonication step often needed here for more complete nucleic acid removal. See below.

source.title: Sonication of Lysate to break up nucleic acids

source.description: Place samples in a 1.5 ml LoBind Protein microfuge tube and prepare a volume balance tube.

source.title: Sonication of Lysate to break up nucleic acids

source.description:
Bring a timer, ear cuffs,
samples, and balance to second floor to Kamakaka Lab to get the plastic tube adaptor (in back of second drawer in 2nd bay from the back of the lab.)

source.title: Sonication of Lysate to break up nucleic acids

source.description: Sonicator is in cold room down the hall. Put the outflow tube up on the shelf and fill glass reservoir with water to top of white line.

source.title: Sonication of Lysate to break up nucleic acids

source.description: Sonicator settings: timer on hold, use max setting (10), constant, then flip on.

source.title: Sonication of Lysate to break up nucleic acids

source.description:

.

source.title: BCA Assay for Protein Concentration Determination

source.description:
Pierce BCA Protein Assay Kit #23225 or #23227, Thermo Sci with 2 mg/ml BSA standard.
Use instructions from kit.
Equilibrate reagents, samples, and standards to
. Use the Microplate reader instructions.

Semi-dry Transfer to PVDF Membrane

source.description: Pre-soak blotting stacks in 1X transfer buffer made according to directions on the bottle.

source.title: Semi-dry Transfer to PVDF Membrane

source.description: Pre-wet PVDF membrane from Biorad Transblot kit in 190 proof ethanol, then in transfer buffer.

source.title: Semi-dry Transfer to PVDF Membrane

source.description: Layer into Transblot drawer (stack, membrane, gel, second stack) before rolling out bubbles gently with conical tube

source.title: Semi-dry Transfer to PVDF Membrane

source.description:
Run the transfer on Biorad setting, standard Mininigel TGX, 25mA, 25V,
.

source.title: Semi-dry Transfer to PVDF Membrane

source.description: While running, pour 5% milk block in 1X PBST directly into cleaned small black Western blot box.

source.title: Semi-dry Transfer to PVDF Membrane

source.description:
Incubate transferred blot for
at
in 5% milk block in 1X PBST.

source.title: Semi-dry Transfer to PVDF Membrane

source.description: Photograph the blot after the transfer to help keep track of orientation.

source.body: Note: Primary antibody (unconjugated with HRP) can be re-used 3x if kept frozen.

source.title: SDS PAGE: Loading and Running Gel

source.description:
Remove gel from package, take off green strip at the bottom, and rinse the wells three times with about
(use 1 ml pipettor).

source.title: running buffer
SDS PAGE: Loading and Running Gel

source.description: Place gel, tall plate facing out in outer side of a holder and the reservoir block at the other to make a running buffer reservoir. Put the other gel holder in place to take up space.

source.title: SDS PAGE: Loading and Running Gel

source.description: Fill the chamber to the 2-gel mark. Make sure there are no leaks before testing the circuit. Test the circuit by checking for bubbles after turning on power to 70 volts.

source.title: SDS PAGE: Loading and Running Gel

source.description:
Using a 20 ul conte-tipped pipettor, load
of the samples in MLB onto gel, as well as
of Biorad Precision Plus protein ladder Dual Color.

source.title: SDS PAGE: Loading and Running Gel

source.description: Run at 100 – 120V, depending on desired resolution, until adequate separation of ladder lanes in sizes regions of interest.

source.title: SDS PAGE: Loading and Running Gel

source.description: Photograph the gel after the run with your phone to help keep track of orientation.

source.title: Antibody Incubations and ECL visualization of target protein bands: Primary and secondary antibody binding

source.description: Drain blot and place between plastic sheets for imaging using Biorad GelDoc, as below. After imaging, the blot can be probed for actin as a protein loading control without stripping the blot, using anti-actin-HRP as described below.

source.title: Antibody Incubations and ECL visualization of target protein bands: Imaging Blot on BioRad ChemiDoc XRS+ (Vollmers lab)

source.description: Place blot on white screen.

source.title: Antibody Incubations and ECL visualization of target protein bands: Imaging Blot on BioRad ChemiDoc XRS+ (Vollmers lab)

source.description: Place screen into chamber drawer.

source.title: Antibody Incubations and ECL visualization of target protein bands: Imaging Blot on BioRad ChemiDoc XRS+ (Vollmers lab)

source.description: Select new protocol, then blot, then chem hi sensitivity and position blot under live focus setting.

source.title: Antibody Incubations and ECL visualization of target protein bands: Imaging Blot on BioRad ChemiDoc XRS+ (Vollmers lab)

source.description: Under Applications, select chemidoc hi sensitivity to photograph target bands. Note the image size, the gain (2X), and bin (2x2) to make sure the image size is the same when the protein standards are photographed in order to be able to merge the images.

source.title: Antibody Incubations and ECL visualization of target protein bands: Imaging Blot on BioRad ChemiDoc XRS+ (Vollmers lab)

source.description: Under Live Acquire, select acquisition settings: 1, 600, for range and total =100 acquisitions (the 100 can be lowered for longer exposure), starting at 0.25 start time for high expression target.

source.title: Antibody Incubations and ECL visualization of target protein bands: Imaging Blot on BioRad ChemiDoc XRS+ (Vollmers lab)

source.description: Freeze and save the image of your choice as it comes up.

source.title: Antibody Incubations and ECL visualization of target protein bands: Imaging Blot on BioRad ChemiDoc XRS+ (Vollmers lab)

source.description: Without moving the blot, take a picture to visualize the protein standards by selecting Custom under Applications, then create an Epi illumination protocol with the same gain and binning as used for photographing the bands (double check the image size prediction under the options…)

source.title: Antibody Incubations and ECL visualization of target protein bands: Imaging Blot on BioRad ChemiDoc XRS+ (Vollmers lab)

source.description: Merge the target bands and the protein standards pictures in Image Lab software using Image tools.

source.body: Note: Imaged blots can be stored at 4ºC in PBST for stripping and re-probing. Some folks also store them frozen in -20ºC flat in plastic bag.

materials.name: 4–15% Mini-PROTEAN® TGX™ Precast Protein Gels, 10-well, 30 µl
Pierce RIPA Lysis and Extraction Buffer
Precision Plus Protein™ Dual Color Standards 500 µl
Precision Plus Protein™ Dual Color Standards 500 µl
Western Blot Box (black size 8.9 cm × 6.5 cm × 2.5 cm)
SuperSignal™ West Pico PLUS Chemiluminescent Substrate

description: This is a Western Blotting Protocol for Brooks Lab, Department of Biomolecular Engineering, University of California, Santa Cruz.
